properties.title: Demo on interfacing with Hippo ECM Repository

section.name: Demo on interfacing with Hippo ECM Repository

subsection.name: Intro
subsection.p: A typical application that interfaces with Hippo Repository most likely has an architecture like the one depicted above. The application consists of a custom software component and a JCR api for communicating in a standarized way with Hippo Repository. This makes it extremely simple to write an application that operates on the content repository. All you have to know is where to get a repository instance and how to manipulate a JCR tree, which has a very self explanatory interface. You'll be suprised by the simplicity of programming against Hippo Repository, while at the same time taking advantage (with no extra effort) of the powerfull features build into Hippo Repository like faceted search.
The following section presents a demo application, demostrating all stated above.

section.name: The Demo

subsection.name: What's the demo all about
subsection.p: In the demo you will walk recusively through a arbitrary directory on the file system, extract some meta-data and store the file accordingly in Hippo Repsitory, then subsequently apply a faceted search on the stored data.

subsection.name: How to run
subsection.p: First checkout the source code from the svn repository and build it using Maven 2.
subsection.source: svn co https://svn.hippocms.org/repos/hippo/hippo-ecm/trunk hippo-ecm cd hippo-ecm/ mvn clean install
subsection.p: Open up http://localhost:8081/repository to check if everthing is working.
Start the user interface for browsing the repository:

Open up http://localhost:8082 to check if everthing is working.
(tip: the location is displayed in the last lines of the shell output)

Now that we have everything up and running we need to configure the demo's pom.xml located in the root of the project. Open pom.xml and look for the arguments tag.
argument 1: the location of your repository
argument 2: the location of your dropbox
argument 3: the username for logging into the repository
argument 4: and the password
Everything configured? Let's start the demo.
subsection.source: cd hipp-ecm/tools/dropbox mvn clean install mvn exec:java

section.subsection:
Prerequisite: knowlegde of facets
Using the user interfave, select the root node.
Add a new node with a name of your choice.
Select this node and add the following properties, hippo:docbase -> dropbox, hippo:facets -> (multi-value) DocType.
Then again select the previously constructed node and the result should look like something as depicted below.
Congratulations! You just ran a custom application interfacing with the Hippo ECM Repository and applyed a facet search on the stored data!
